message_1: A sample of a radioactive material has an initial activity of 2000 Bq. Calculate the activity after 5 half-lives have elapsed. Given that the half-life of the material is 15 days, what will be the activity of the sample after 75 days?
message_2:
To calculate the activity of the radioactive material after a certain number of half-lives, we can use the formula:

Final activity (A) = Initial activity (A0) * (1/2)^n

where n is the number of half-lives elapsed.

In this case, the initial activity (A0) is 2000 Bq, and we want to find the activity after 5 half-lives.

n = 5

A = 2000 * (1/2)^5
A = 2000 * (1/32)
A = 62.5 Bq

So, the activity of the sample after 5 half-lives (75 days) will be 62.5 Bq.
